intro: Lesquerella argyraea var. diffusa, commonly known as the silverleaf lesquerella, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which reflects its common name, and produces small, yellow flowers. The plant is part of the Brassicaceae family, known for its cruciform flowers and seed pods. Lesquerella argyraea var. diffusa is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system for water absorption. Its seeds contain oils that have been studied for potential industrial and agricultural applications.
